content:
You might want to ask enterprise questions in the enterprise list where folk with experience in these enterprise type settings and windows policies will be found. https://thunderbird.topicbox.com/groups/enterprise.

My reading of the settings here does not align with that you are saying. For version 115 you would just disable updates now as it has been out of support for some time, 16 will have been he last point release. So there will be no updates. Ever based on this email https://thunderbird.topicbox.com/groups/planning/T6689f5ad30cc4731-Mf77a2c4c3ba54c23286a9d04

content:
First check in account settings > copies and folder that is it not defined as the Drafts folder. It certainly have the special flag as a drafts folder set, or it would not have the drafts icon.

If it is set, change the account settings drafts folder to something else and that will allow deletion. (note that the setting as a dafts folder can be for an account that has nothing really to do with Local folders, so any accounts that are configured need to be checked.

If that fails to find a valid reason for the folder to have the flag. there is always this addon. https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/folderflags/?src=ss

However it looks like it is still awaiting an update to V128.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:

content: The default text colour for selected messages is white (with the system or light themes), so I don't know why it's black on your main PC. Does the same thing happen in safe/troubleshoot mode (hold Shift when launching TB)? It is possible to set the text and background colours with userChrome, so make sure to check if you have that, if there is a userChrome.css file. Note that userChrome is bypassed in safe mode.
creator: sfhowes

content: In Settings/General, Incoming Mails, App Icon Options, select 'count of unread messages'. That seems to display the number in the icon that's useful.
creator: sfhowes

content: That value is checked, but my taskbar icon doesn't display any numbers or any indication of new emails. There is little bar underneath it that highlights when thunderbird is not minimized, but that's it. I wonder if its some kind of windows setting that is hiding the values. I went through the windows settings for taskbar behavior to see if I could figure anything out but still now showing anything.
